Chapter 32, Part 2: The TathÄgata's Nature Arising, Like a Jewel King
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should also know the TathÄgata's nature arising and the true Dharma:
Because the merit is immeasurable and the practice is immeasurable;
It fills the ten directions, because there is no coming or going;
It is apart from arising, abiding, and ceasing, because there is no practice;
It is apart from mind, thought, and cognition, because there is no body;
Its nature is like space, because it is all equal;
All sentient beings are without self and what belongs to self, because it is inexhaustible;
All lands are inexhaustible, because there is no turning;
It does not end the future, because there is no regression;
The TathÄgata's wisdom is without doubt and non-dual, because it observes equally the conditioned and the unconditioned;
Attaining perfect supreme enlightenment, benefiting sentient beings, because the original practices and dedications are freely fulfilled.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, wanting to restate this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
All of you listen attentively to the Dharma of the TathÄgata's ten powers,
The most supreme in all worlds, without compare,
All equal to the unequaled, also equal to space,
Virtues without equal, the realm immeasurable.
All TathÄgatas have immeasurable merits,
Other types of sentient beings cannot conceive of them.
A single Dharma door of the TathÄgata, all beings,
For immeasurable billions of eons, contemplating cannot exhaust it.
Buddha lands in the ten directions, completely reduced to dust motes,
Someone can calculate and understand their number.
That person, for innumerable eons, calculates the tathÄgatas,
But cannot know even a small portion of the merit of a single hair.
It is like a single person who can measure the realm of space,
And another person who can follow the calculation and know the measure.
For countless eons, the measurement of space can be exhausted,
But the merits of the TathÄgata cannot be fully known.
It is like a person who, in a single thought,
Can count the mental activities of the minds of sentient beings in the three times,
And sentient beings can still be counted, even if for eons,
But the immeasurable virtues of the TathÄgata cannot be fully enumerated.
It is like the Dharma realm, whose limits cannot be found,
All are not all, not seen, and cannot be grasped,
Thus the realm of the TathÄgatas cannot be fully measured,
All are not all, the Dharma realm is endless.
It is like the nature of suchness, free from delusion and quiescent,
There is neither birth nor cessation,
Thus are all TathÄgatas and all realms,
Also the same as the nature of suchness, neither increasing nor decreasing.
It is like the future limit, the limit of reality is boundless,
The nature of the three times is inherently detached, the truth cannot be attained.
Thus is the perfect enlightenment, the realm is also like this,
In all the three times, penetrating without obstruction.
All dharmas are changeless, the nature is empty and unconditioned,
Free from defilement and pollution, its nature is like space.
All TathÄgatas, the pure nature is also thus,
All natures are natureless, neither existent nor nonexistent.
The nature of the true Dharma is far removed from all verbal expressions,
All destinies and non-destinies are of the nature of quiescent extinction.
The realm of all TathÄgatas is also like this,
Far removed from the path of language, it cannot be used as a metaphor.
The Buddhas awaken to the Dharma, whose nature and characteristics are all quiescent and extinguished,
Like a bird flying in the sky, its footprints cannot be found.
The fruits of immeasurable great vows accomplish the pure form body,
Endowed with the merits of the ten powers, manifesting great spiritual transformations.
If there are those who wish to know the profound Dharma of the TathÄgatas,
They should purify their minds, making them like empty space.
Far removed from false and deluded thoughts, as well as from wrong views and inversions,
Cultivating the pure path, they will ultimately attain the pure mind.
Therefore, all Buddha's disciples, listen single-mindedly and well,
The realm of all the Well-Gone Ones, I shall now explain a small part.
The merits of all the Ten Powers are innumerable,
In order to awaken the multitude of beings, I shall now explain a little.
All the Guides, with their pure physical actions,
Pure verbal actions and pure mental actions, their realms are all pure.
The profound realm of the TathÄgatas, the pure and wondrous Dharma wheel,
And the wholesome roots of nirvÄá¹‡a, I shall now explain in detail.
Just as when the great trichiliocosm was first formed,
It was not due to a few causes and conditions that the world was formed.
With immeasurable skillful means and power, all causes and conditions arose,
And the trichiliocosm was established, with all beings.
In the same way, the supreme ones, the TathÄgatas, the Dharma of arising,
With immeasurable stores of merit, all cannot fully comprehend.
The worlds in the ten directions are all reduced to fine dust,ğŸ”½Counting the fine dust and knowing the minds of sentient beings,
The number of fine dust and sentient beings' minds can still be known,
But the merits of all the ten powers cannot be known.
It is like a heavy cloud that can pour down heavy rain,
Four kinds of wind wheels arise that can form the trichiliocosm.
The wholesome roots of sentient beings and the power of the merits of bodhisattvas,
The trichiliocosm arises and places the various kinds of sentient beings.
The TathÄgata is also like this, the Dharma cloud of causes and conditions arises,
The great wisdom wind wheel, the mind of purity free from defilements,
In all the places of the buddhas, cultivating wholesome roots,
Turning toward and giving to sentient beings, quickly attaining perfect enlightenment.
It is like in the sky, the rain from clouds is called a great downpour,
No one else in the world is able to bear it.
Except for the great trichiliocosm, when it is first formed,
The immovable wind wheel, which relies on the realm of space.
The TathÄgata is also like this. When he first attains perfect enlightenment,
In all worlds in the ten directions, the Dharma cloud rains down heavily,
Filling the supreme Dharma realm, but no one is able to bear it.
Only the great bodhisattvas, who have accomplished immeasurable virtues,
In the sky, clouds gather and rain falls, but there is no doer or creator.
Originally, it does not come from anywhere, and when it goes, it does not arrive anywhere.
The TathÄgata is also like this. The Dharma cloud rains down sweet dew,
Originally, it does not come from anywhere, and when it goes, it does not arrive anywhere.
All the bodhisattvas cultivate immeasurable practices,
In accordance with those who should receive the teachings, for them it rains the true Dharma.
It is like a great cloud raining, no one can count it,
Only Mahesvara can fully understand and know.
The Well-Gone One is also like this, raining immeasurable Dharma rain,
Filling all buddha-lands, no one can count it.
Only the unsurpassed Dharma King, the lord of all worlds,
Can fully understand and know it, like observing a treasure in the palm of the hand.
What should be extinguished can be extinguished, what should arise can be caused to arise,
Eliminating all wrong views, nurturing the treasure of merit.
The TathÄgata rains the true Dharma, eliminating all afflictions,
Giving rise to innumerable, immeasurable wholesome roots.
Cultivating right views, far from all inversions,
All the most excellent ones deeply understand the treasure of merit.
It is like in the sky, universally raining a single flavor of water,
The different things that arise from the power of sentient beings' karmic retribution.
The TathÄgata rains down the Dharma with the water of great compassion,
Teaching in various ways to suit those to be guided.
When the world first forms, the palaces of the form realm appear first,
Then the palaces of the devas in the desire realm are created in sequence,
Next, in the human realm, each person builds their own dwelling,
Then the abodes of the gandharvas and nÄgas are created in order.
The TathÄgata is also like this. Having just attained perfect enlightenment,
He first gives rise to the practices of the bodhisattvas, then the pratyekabuddha vehicle is accomplished,
And then he guides those whose minds are self-controlled, all the Å›rÄvakas,
Then he causes sentient beings to cultivate various wholesome roots.
Seeing the pure lotus flowers, the devas know that a Buddha has appeared in the world,
Because the rain can give rise to wind, and the wind can give rise to the world,
The TathÄgata emits light, distinguishing the buddhas and bodhisattvas,
Able to activate the wheel of wisdom, penetrating the buddhas' teachings.
Water relies on the wind wheel to exist, the earth relies on the water wheel,
The various jeweled trees rely on the earth, space has no support.
The wheel of wisdom relies on the TathÄgata, compassion relies on wisdom,
Merit relies on skillful means, the Dharma body has no support.
Just as the earth arises, benefiting all sentient beings,
The various kinds of beings in the water and on land, each attaining peace and happiness.
The sentient beings relying on space, and the gods of the desire and form realms,
The two-legged, four-legged, and so forth, all are benefited.
The Dharma King is also like this, appearing in the world,
Causing all sentient beings to be benefited.
If people have seen, heard, respectfully made offerings,
Eliminating all afflictions, deeply understanding the TathÄgata's teachings.
The TathÄgata's arising of nature, the world cannot know,
I speak a small portion, for the benefit of sentient beings.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva said to the bodhisattvas:
Buddha's disciples!
How do bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas know and see the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One?
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows and sees the TathÄgata, fully accomplishing immeasurable merits.
Why is it so?
The TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is not for the sake of one dharma, one practice, one body, or one realm to transform a single sentient being;

This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows and sees the TathÄgata, fully accomplishing immeasurable dharmas, immeasurable practices, immeasurable bodies, and immeasurable realms, equally teaching and transforming all sentient beings.
Buddha's disciples!
It is like space, which reaches everywhere, to all places with form and without form, yet it does not reach anywhere and does not not reach anywhere.
Why is this?
Because space is formless.
The Dharma body of the TathÄgata is also like this, reaching everywhere, to all lands, all dharmas, and all sentient beings, yet it does not reach anywhere.
Why is this?
Because the body of the TathÄgatas is not a body.
It manifests its body in accordance with what is to be transformed.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the first gateway of superior practice entered by the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, knowing and seeing the TathÄgata.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
It is like space, which is vast and can contain all sentient beings without attachment;
The Dharma body of the TathÄgata is also like this, illuminating the wholesome roots of the world of all sentient beings and the wholesome roots apart from the world without attachment.
Why is this?
Because the TathÄgata's Dharma body has already severed all attachments.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the second superior practice of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, knowing and seeing the TathÄgata.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
It is like the sun rising in the world, benefiting sentient beings with innumerable matters, namely:
Eliminating darkness, nurturing all mountains, forests, herbs, grains, plants, and eliminating dampness;
Illuminating the sky, benefiting sentient beings in the sky;
Illuminating the pond, able to open lotus flowers, universally illuminating all forms and appearances, and worldly projects are all completed.
Why is it so?
Because the sun can universally emit immeasurable light;
The TathÄgata's sun is also like this. With innumerable matters, it can universally benefit all sentient beings, namely:

Great compassion benefits, rescuing and protecting sentient beings;
Great compassion benefits, liberating all;
The benefit of the true Dharma, nurturing all faculties, powers, and enlightenment factors;
The benefit of firm faith, eliminating the turbidity of the mind;
The benefit of seeing the Dharma, not destroying causes and conditions;
The benefit of the heavenly eye, seeing all sentient beings die here and be born there;
The benefit of being free from harm, not destroying the wholesome roots of sentient beings;
The benefit of the light of wisdom, blooming the mind flowers of all sentient beings;
The benefit of arousing the mind, ultimately practicing all the bodhisattva practices.
Why is it so?
Because the sun of the TathÄgata's body universally emits the light of wisdom.
Buddha's disciple!
This is the third supreme practice of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, knowing and seeing the TathÄgata.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!
It is like the sun rising, first illuminating all the great mountain kings, then all the great mountains, then the diamond treasure mountain, and finally universally illuminating the entire earth.
The sunlight does not think:
'I should first illuminate the great mountain kings, and then in sequence universally illuminate the earth.'
But because those mountains and earth have high and low places, there is a sequence in the illumination;

The TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is also like this. Having accomplished the sun-disk of wisdom in the immeasurable and boundless Dharma realm, always emitting the light of immeasurable and unobstructed wisdom, first illuminating the great mountain kings, namely the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, next illuminating the pratyekabuddhas, next illuminating the Å›rÄvakas, next illuminating those sentient beings with determined wholesome roots, according with their suitability for being transformed, and then universally illuminating all sentient beings, even up to those with wrong views, creating the causes and conditions for benefiting them in the future.

'I will first illuminate the bodhisattvas, and so on, up to those of wrong concentration.'
But he emits the great light of wisdom, universally illuminating everything.
Buddha's disciple!
It is like the sun and moon appearing in the world, even the deep mountains and secluded valleys are universally illuminated;

But because the hopes and wholesome roots of sentient beings are not the same, the light of the TathÄgata's wisdom has various distinctions.

Furthermore, Buddha's disciple!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, endowed with and accomplishing immeasurable pure minds, filling the ten directions, deeply entering the Dharma realm, abiding in true reality, without arising or ceasing, equal in the three times, all able to eliminate all delusions.
Entering the future limit, the true Dharma filling all worlds, all Dharma realms, all Buddha bodies, with immeasurable adornments.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva MahÄsattva, wanting to restate this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
Just as the nature of space reaches everywhere,
In the worlds of the ten directions, all buddha-lands,
In the realm of form and the formless realm, all kinds of sentient beings,
The past, present, and future, neither reached nor not reached.
All the most victorious ones, with their pure and wondrous Dharma bodies,
Reaching everywhere, filling all Dharma realms.
The supreme and wondrous dharma body, all are unable to see it,
In order to teach and transform sentient beings, the guide manifests it.
It is like the nature of space, which no one can grasp,
It universally enables all beings to create various karmas without obstruction.
Space has no thought of What am I doing now?
How does one create?
For whom does one create?
Thus, all the supreme ones, because of this pure bodily karma,
Universally enable all beings to accomplish the pure white dharmas.
The TathÄgata's pure dharma body benefits immeasurable multitudes,
The dharma body also has no thought of benefiting all beings.
It is like the bright and pure sun appearing in JambudvÄ«pa,
Eliminating all darkness and universally illuminating all without exception.
All the jeweled mountains, the earth, and the various flower ponds,
According to the circumstances, they nurture and benefit all beings.
The supreme sun benefits all beings in this way,
Causing all living beings to nurture their wholesome roots.
Accomplishing the light of wisdom, eliminating all darkness,
Seeing the guides, replete with all happiness.
Just as when the sun rises, it first illuminates the great mountain kings,
And then in sequence illuminates all the great mountains,
Next it illuminates the smaller mountains and other high and prominent places,
And then it universally illuminates the great earth of the world.
The Well-Gone One is also like this, with the sun-like light of pure wisdom,
First illuminating the mountain kings of merit of the bodhisattvas,
And then in sequence illuminating all the pratyekabuddhas,

It is like the bright and pure sun appearing in the world.
Although the blind cannot see it, it can bring benefit,
Eliminating hunger, thirst, and afflictions, and causing the body to be soft and blissful.
Know that the bright and pure sun benefits all without exception.

Although there are those without the eye of faith, it still brings benefit.
Some hear the TathÄgata's voice, some touch the light of the guide,
Acting as a cause and condition for them, ultimately attaining enlightenment.
It is like the full moon outshining the stars,
Showing all beings whether it is waxing or waning.
In all clear waters, the moon's reflection is nowhere absent.
All the various beings in the world, all see with their eyes,
The most supreme and pure full moon, outshines the two vehicles,
According to those who receive the teachings, they manifest long or short lifespans,
The reflection appears to humans and gods, the vessel of pure bodhi,
Each and every one thinks to themselves, I am facing the Honored One of gods and humans,

Everywhere in the great chiliocosm, he universally manifests the body of the Brahma king,
Fully endowed with the power of mastery, he manifests immeasurable bodies,
There is no place where he is not seen, and his body is also not divided.

In all the lands of the ten directions, he universally manifests immeasurable bodies,
Bodies that cannot be measured, all are unable to see,
Universally responding to beings, yet he does not divide his body.
